recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.instructions: Cook spaghetti. Fry pancetta and garlic. Beat eggs and mix with cheese. Combine everything off heat, season, and serve.

recipes.title: Lasagna
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a skillet, heat olive oil and cook ground beef until browned. Add onion and garlic; sauté until soft. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, pepper, and sugar. Simmer for 20 minutes. In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, Parmesan, and parsley. In a baking dish, layer noodles, meat sauce, ricotta mixture, and mozzarella. Repeat layers and finish with mozzarella on top. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes, then uncover and bake for another 20 minutes until bubbly and golden. Let rest 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Red Beans and Rice
ingredients: 2 15 oz cans of red kidney beans, rinsed
recipes.instructions: Cook white rice in pot for 18 minutes. In another pot, heat oil and brown the sausage and onion. Add the rinsed beans, chicken broth, and Cajun seasoning. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve over hot rice.

recipes.title: Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
recipes.instructions: Spoon 1/2 cup enchilada sauce into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. In a large saucepan, cook and stir the cream cheese and salsa over medium heat until blended, two to three minutes. Stir in the chicken, beans and chiles. Place about 1/3 cup chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla. Roll up and place seam side down over the sauce. Top with remaining enchilada sauce, and sprinkle with cheese. Cover and bake at 350°F until heated through, 25 to 30 minutes. If desired, serve with lettuce, tomato, sour cream and olives.
